trans-unit.source: Get Search Service
trans-unit.target: Get Search Service

trans-unit.source: Get Search Service (Azure Search Management REST API)
trans-unit.target: Get Search Service (Azure Search Management REST API)

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get Search Service</languageKeyword> operation returns the properties for the specified Search service.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get Search Service</languageKeyword> operation returns the properties for the specified Search service.

trans-unit.source: Note that admin keys are not returned.
trans-unit.target: Note that admin keys are not returned.

trans-unit.source: Use the <link xlink:href="21dfc36c-e979-4aa3-9f33-1ceaed809546" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Admin Keys (Azure Search API)</link> to retrieve the admin keys.
trans-unit.target: Use the <link xlink:href="21dfc36c-e979-4aa3-9f33-1ceaed809546" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Admin Keys (Azure Search API)</link> to retrieve the admin keys.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is required for all service requests.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is required for all service requests.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get Search Service</languageKeyword> request is constructed using a GET method.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get Search Service</languageKeyword> request is constructed using a GET method.

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: Request Parameter
trans-unit.target: Request Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>subscriptionID</codeInline> for the Azure user.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>subscriptionID</codeInline> for the Azure user.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name of the resource group within the user’s subscription.
trans-unit.target: The name of the resource group within the user’s subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name of the search service within the specified resource group.
trans-unit.target: The name of the search service within the specified resource group.

trans-unit.source: If you don't know the service name, you can obtain a list using <link xlink:href="476d5360-2219-4b51-8e72-3cc6b08386ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Search Services (Azure Search API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't know the service name, you can obtain a list using <link xlink:href="476d5360-2219-4b51-8e72-3cc6b08386ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Search Services (Azure Search API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The version of the protocol used for this request.
trans-unit.target: The version of the protocol used for this request.

trans-unit.source: The current version is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The current version is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The previous version, <codeInline>2014-07-31-Preview</codeInline>, is deprecated.
trans-unit.target: The previous version, <codeInline>2014-07-31-Preview</codeInline>, is deprecated.

trans-unit.source: Although it will continue to work for the next several months, we encourage you to transition to the current version as soon as possible.
trans-unit.target: Although it will continue to work for the next several months, we encourage you to transition to the current version as soon as possible.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A client-generated GUID value that identifies this request.
trans-unit.target: A client-generated GUID value that identifies this request.

trans-unit.source: If specified, this will be included in response information as a way to map the request.
trans-unit.target: If specified, this will be included in response information as a way to map the request.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: HTTP 200 (OK) if successful
trans-unit.target: HTTP 200 (OK) if successful

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: The following headers are part of the response.
trans-unit.target: The following headers are part of the response.

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: This header is always set to application/json.
trans-unit.target: This header is always set to application/json.

trans-unit.source: A unique identifier for the current operation generated by the service.
trans-unit.target: A unique identifier for the current operation generated by the service.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: Response Body Elements
trans-unit.target: Response Body Elements

trans-unit.source: Element
trans-unit.target: Element

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The id is the URL (excluding the hostname/scheme) for this Search service.
trans-unit.target: The id is the URL (excluding the hostname/scheme) for this Search service.

trans-unit.source: The name of the Search service.
trans-unit.target: The name of the Search service.

trans-unit.source: One of the supported and registered Azure Geo Regions (for example, West US, East US, Southeast Asia, and so forth).
trans-unit.target: One of the supported and registered Azure Geo Regions (for example, West US, East US, Southeast Asia, and so forth).

trans-unit.source: A list of key-value pairs that describe the resource, used in viewing and grouping resources across resource groups.
trans-unit.target: A list of key-value pairs that describe the resource, used in viewing and grouping resources across resource groups.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: Valid values include:
trans-unit.target: Valid values include:

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>free</codeInline>: Shared cluster
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>free</codeInline>: Shared cluster

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>standard</codeInline>: Dedicated cluster
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>standard</codeInline>: Dedicated cluster

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>standard2</codeInline>: Use only under the guidance of Microsoft support.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>standard2</codeInline>: Use only under the guidance of Microsoft support.

trans-unit.source: Indicates how many replicas the service has.
trans-unit.target: Indicates how many replicas the service has.

trans-unit.source: Valid values are 1 through 6.
trans-unit.target: Valid values are 1 through 6.

trans-unit.source: Indicates how many partitions the service has.
trans-unit.target: Indicates how many partitions the service has.

trans-unit.source: Valid values include 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, or 12.
trans-unit.target: Valid values include 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, or 12.

trans-unit.source: The status of the Search service at the time the operation was called.
trans-unit.target: The status of the Search service at the time the operation was called.

trans-unit.source: Valid values include:
trans-unit.target: Valid values include:

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>Running</codeInline>: The Search service is created.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>Running</codeInline>: The Search service is created.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>provisioning</codeInline>: The Search service is being provisioned.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>provisioning</codeInline>: The Search service is being provisioned.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>deleting</codeInline>: The Search service is being deleted.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>deleting</codeInline>: The Search service is being deleted.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>degraded</codeInline>: The Search service is degraded.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>degraded</codeInline>: The Search service is degraded.

trans-unit.source: This can occur when the cluster is not healthy.
trans-unit.target: This can occur when the cluster is not healthy.

trans-unit.source: The Search service is most likely operational, but performance might be slow and some requests might be dropped.
trans-unit.target: The Search service is most likely operational, but performance might be slow and some requests might be dropped.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>disabled</codeInline>: The Search service is disabled.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>disabled</codeInline>: The Search service is disabled.

trans-unit.source: In this state, the service will reject all API requests.
trans-unit.target: In this state, the service will reject all API requests.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>error</codeInline>: The Search service is in error state.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>error</codeInline>: The Search service is in error state.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Search team actively investigates all incidents involving service disruption or degradation so that service is restored as quickly as possible.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Search team actively investigates all incidents involving service disruption or degradation so that service is restored as quickly as possible.

trans-unit.source: Please be advised that dedicated services in these states are still chargeable based on the number of search units provisioned, at the preview rate.
trans-unit.target: Please be advised that dedicated services in these states are still chargeable based on the number of search units provisioned, at the preview rate.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Preview supplemental terms of use</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/</linkUri></externalLink> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Preview supplemental terms of use</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/</linkUri></externalLink> for more information.

trans-unit.source: The details of status.
trans-unit.target: The details of status.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the current state of the service provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the current state of the service provisioning.

trans-unit.source: Valid values include:
trans-unit.target: Valid values include:

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>succeeded</codeInline>: Provisioning was successful.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>succeeded</codeInline>: Provisioning was successful.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>provisioning</codeInline>: The service is being provisioned.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>provisioning</codeInline>: The service is being provisioned.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>failed</codeInline>: Provisioning failed.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>failed</codeInline>: Provisioning failed.

trans-unit.source: Provisioning is an intermediate state that occurs while service capacity is being established.
trans-unit.target: Provisioning is an intermediate state that occurs while service capacity is being established.

trans-unit.source: After capacity is set up, <codeInline>provisioningState</codeInline> changes to either "succeeded" or "failed".
trans-unit.target: After capacity is set up, <codeInline>provisioningState</codeInline> changes to either "succeeded" or "failed".

trans-unit.source: Client applications can poll provisioning status (recommended polling interval is 30 seconds, up to a minute) by using the <languageKeyword>Get Search Service</languageKeyword> operation to see when an operation is completed.
trans-unit.target: Client applications can poll provisioning status (recommended polling interval is 30 seconds, up to a minute) by using the <languageKeyword>Get Search Service</languageKeyword> operation to see when an operation is completed.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the free service, this value tends to come back as "succeeded" directly in the call to create service.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the free service, this value tends to come back as "succeeded" directly in the call to create service.

trans-unit.source: This is because the free service uses capacity that is already set up.
trans-unit.target: This is because the free service uses capacity that is already set up.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Search Management REST API
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Search Management REST API

trans-unit.source: Manage your Search service on Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage your Search service on Microsoft Azure
